author: murrayhenson
title: Semper paratus ...to play with
review:
My review of 60015 "Coast Guard Plane" will be fairly short because there's already an excellent review with lots of nice photos already here on Brickset, done by Matthew.  http://www.brickset.com/news/article/?ID=7374 


To add to the aforementioned review are my impressions and opinions:


  • Plane interior:  first and foremost, while the plane's significant logicial shortcoming (room for the pilot only) is somewhat irritating, that is really on an AFOL-level.  I honestly think that the children this set is actually aimed at won't really notice or significantly care.
  • Playability:  ironically, the boat floats despite its role as stricken craft ...and the plane, of course, does not float.  However, boats that float are excellent fun, no ifs ands or buts!
  • The build:  even I, a slow builder, found this to be a fairly quick and simple build.  This is probably down to the use of a several large, single pieces (boat hull, plane nose).  However, as this set is aimed at children as young as 5 years old, a simple build may not be such a bad thing given the ultimate size and look of the finished pieces.
  • PPP:  the previously noted large pieces also obviously ruin the PPP figure.  However, as I waited until the set was on sale at amazon.co.uk and paid 27 GBP for it, I feel the price that I paid was reasonable.
  • Appearances:  The plane, in particular, is really quite good-looking.  I think it's the first plane I've had that looked better "in real life" than in the various photos.  The plane is pretty good-size and has a non-trivial weight to it as well which makes it more fun to zoom around.
  • Analogues:  While the plane is good-looking, it doesn't exactly look like a real plane - at least not that I could determine.  It, verrrry vaguely, might bear a resemblance to the EADS HC-144 Ocean Sentry used by the US Coast Guard.

Overall, I happen to like this set - thus why I gave it a 4/5 rating.  It's obviously not without its issues, but as no set can claim to be perfect the little imperfections don't terribly bother me.  I'd recommend this to fans of planes, kids that like to play with sets in the tub, and people that like the colour orange.
